Key Match Events: Carlos Rodon gave the Yankees six strong innings after a difficult Game 2 start against the Royals in the ALDS.
Cleveland left-hander Joey Cantillo unleashed two wild pitches that scored runs in the bottom of the third inning and added two more in the fourth.
Luke Weaver picked up his fourth save and got out of a mess in the eighth inning.
The Yankees drew 7 walks in Game 1 of the ALCS, which should help wear down a taxed Cleveland staff.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Rizzo commented on Rodon’s performance, saying 'He set the tone.'
